name: Verify Platform-Reported Revenue
tagline: Know if your ROAS is real or inflated
description: Ad platforms often over-report conversions. metricx connects to Shopify to verify exactly how much revenue actually came from your ads.
problem: Meta and Google both claim credit for the same sales. Your true ROAS could be 30-50% lower than platforms report. Without verification, you're optimizing blind.
solution: metricx connects to Shopify and matches orders to ad clicks. You see both platform-reported and Shopify-verified revenue side by side, revealing your true performance.
benefits: Know your real ROAS, not inflated numbers
testimonialSnippet: We discovered our Meta ROAS was 40% overstated. metricx saved us from scaling a losing campaign.

faqs.question: How does verification work?
faqs.answer: metricx matches Shopify orders to ad platform click data using UTM parameters and timing. You see which orders are verified vs platform-only attributed.

faqs.question: What if numbers don't match?
faqs.answer: Some gap is normal due to attribution windows and view-through conversions. metricx shows you the gap size so you can factor it into decisions.

name: Calculate True Customer LTV by Channel
tagline: Know which ads bring your best customers
description: Not all customers are equal. metricx tracks customer lifetime value by acquisition channel so you know which ads attract high-value, repeat buyers.
problem: You're optimizing for first-purchase CPA, but some channels attract one-time buyers while others bring loyal customers. Without LTV data, you're missing the big picture.
solution: metricx calculates LTV by tracking repeat purchases in Shopify and attributing them back to original acquisition source. See which campaigns bring customers who keep buying.
benefits: Optimize for long-term value, not just conversions
Justify higher CAC for better channels

faqs.question: How is LTV calculated?
faqs.answer: metricx sums all purchases from a customer over time and attributes that value to their original acquisition source. You can view 30/60/90-day and lifetime LTV.

faqs.question: Can I see LTV by campaign, not just platform?
faqs.answer: Yes, LTV tracking goes down to campaign level, so you can identify specific campaigns that attract high-value customers.

name: New Customer vs Returning Analysis
tagline: Know if ads bring new customers or existing ones
description: Are your ads acquiring new customers or just re-acquiring existing ones? metricx separates new vs returning customer revenue so you know your true acquisition cost.
problem: Platforms count any conversion as success. But if you're paying to convert existing customers who would have bought anyway, your true CAC is much higher.
solution: metricx uses Shopify customer data to identify first-time vs repeat purchasers. See what percentage of ad-attributed revenue comes from truly new customers.
testimonialSnippet: 60% of our 'conversions' were existing customers. Our real CAC was 2.5x what we thought.

faqs.question: How does metricx identify new customers?
faqs.answer: metricx checks Shopify customer history. If it's their first order, they're counted as new; otherwise, returning.

faqs.question: Should I care about this split?
faqs.answer: Yes, especially for CAC calculations. If you're paying acquisition costs for existing customers, you're overstating efficiency.
